docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Here's a Heading
docs.text: Try to put a blank line before...

docs.title: Paragraphs
docs.text: To create paragraphs, use a blank line to separate one or more lines of text.

docs.title: Markdown
docs.text:
I really like using Markdown.

I think I'll use it to format all of my documents from now on.

docs.title: HTML
docs.text:
I really like using Markdown.

I think I'll use it to format all of my documents from now on.

docs.title: Blockquotes
docs.text:
To create a blockquote, add a > in front of a paragraph.

Dorothy followed her through many of the beautiful rooms in her castle.

Nested Blockquotes

Blockquotes can be nested. Add a >> in front of the paragraph you want to nest.

Dorothy followed her through many of the beautiful rooms in her castle.

The Witch bade her clean the pots and kettles and sweep the floor and keep the fire fed with wood.

docs.title: Code
docs.text:
At the command prompt, type nano.

At the command prompt, type nano.

docs.title: Escaping Backticks
docs.text:
Use `code` in your Markdown file.

Use code in your Markdown file.

md Sintax. mkdocs-material. mkdocs-material-reference.

code.py
def main():
print()
print()
print()
print()
print()
print()

docs.title: Basic Commands
docs.text:
run the Django command-line utilities to create the database tables automatically:

$ python manage.py makemigrations # (1)
  1. 🙋 The makemigrations command looks at all your available models and creates migrations for whichever tables don’t already exist. 
$ python manage.py migrate # (1)
  1. migrate runs the migrations and creates tables in your database, as well as optionally providing much richer schema control.

docs.title: Using abbr from markdown_extensions
docs.text:
markdown_extensions:
  - abbr

The HTML specification is maintained by the W3C.

docs.title: Using admonition from markdown_extensions
docs.text:
markdown_extensions:
  - admonition

optional explicit title within double quotes

Any number of other indented markdown elements.

This is the second paragraph.

Collapsible blocks¶

When Details is enabled and an admonition block is started with ??? instead of !!!, the admonition is rendered as a collapsible block with a small toggle on the right side:

??? note

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nulla et euismod
nulla. Curabitur feugiat, tortor non consequat finibus, justo purus auctor
massa, nec semper lorem quam in massa.

# Code block content
name: PyYAML CI
on:
push:
pull_request:
types: [opened, synchronize, reopened]
workflow_dispatch:
env:
LIBYAML_REPO: https://github.com/yaml/libyaml
LIBYAML_REF: 0.2.5
